page.title: 13Farming
page.content: of crops are grown so there is a combine harvester, 3 tractors and potato harvester. He employs 3 men full-time, 2 live in tied cottages and others work seasonally. Wye Court is 187 acres and belongs to the Long family. There 67 sheep but these may sometimes go to other farms outside the area. 10 acres are hay and the rest arable. There 2 harvesters, 9 tractors and various other implements. He employs 5 men, 4 in tied cottages. Sheep shearing and crop spraying are done by contractors. Ripple Farm is 15 acres and owned by Mr C. Bauer. He has beef cattle and makes hay. Silage is made by contractors. He employs 1 man. There is a mushroom farm at Bilting. The mushrooms are grown in sheds, picked, packed, and distributed locally, in Thanet and in London.
